inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of requiring Rotator Cuff repair surgical treatment
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: MRI of the head revealed an acute 1.7-cm infarct of the right periventricular white matter and posterior right basal ganglia.

inclusion.criterion: Willingness and ability to comply with the requirements of the protocol including follow-up requirements.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient was admitted to the intensive care unit to be monitored for 24 hours.

inclusion.criterion: Will and able to sign a study specific informed consent form to participate.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Age range of ≥ 30 years old and ≤ 80 years old at time of surgery.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Previous Rotator cuff repair or shoulder surgery.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Active systemic infection or infection at the operative site.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Co-morbid medical conditions of the upper extremities that may affect the neurological and/or pain assessment.
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: His vital signs were stable in the primary evaluation.

exclusion.criterion: History of an endocrine or metabolic disorder (e.g., Paget's disease) known to affect bone and mineral metabolism.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Taking medications that may interfere with bony/soft tissue healing including chronic steroid use.
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: He is using Levothyroxine, Atorvastatin and HTCZ.

exclusion.criterion: Rheumatoid arthritis or other autoimmune disease or a systemic disorder such as HIV, active hepatitis B or C or fibromyalgia.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has hypertension, hyperlipidemia and hypothyroidism. He smokes cigarette 1 pack per day for 40 years and alcohol consumption of 5 to 6 beers per week.
